author: arthur.leinweber - WISE pool
title: Data driven Cardano services
description: People new to Cardano ecosystem are often **overwhelmed** when it comes to **technology, pool selection for staking** as well as choosing a wallet.

assessments.note: The challenge seemed focused on Dapps an integrations that promote Cardano adoption. The proposal specifically wants to increase participation in the delegation process by simplifying the decision making and tracking involved in delegation. The tools outlined could be attractive to new delegators and increase participation in the proof of stake mechanism.  But to really meet the challenge the proposal should focus on how  to attract first-time delegators.

The proposer identifies several good ideas to provide utility for Cardano users and fits the challenge parameters. The solution statement given is very generic, but the services provided by the proposed platform are better explained further along in the proposal. However, since so many services are being proposed, there isin't very much information given about any one of them in particular and which problems they solve. It's my opinion that the proposal might be better served by focusing on a single service instead of an entire platform.

The proposal has a good impact to make it easier for newcomers to stake their ADA as the system is currently designed. Although, I believe that other solutions, like intermediary solutions (without compromising security and ownership) or even improvements in the staking system itself, might solve the problems described in the problem statement in this proposal in the medium/long term. Although, this might be a good temporary solution until something directly related to the staking system changes. Also, I believe that the requested budget is a bit too high for the kind of development proposed.

The simplicity and fluidity in Cardano staking are perfect, leading to wide options.  There is substantial discussion of staking, the performance of pools, and accountability of few mission-driven pools. Therefore the proposed platform is required and is likely to have an impact on the community.

The proposer provides a timeline but the description of what will be accomplished at each stage is very vague. What does it mean to build a data platform? Are all the services being worked on at the same time? I'm concerned that with the scope of this proposal and its multiple services, a team of a single developer working 4 hours a day for 120 days would be hard-pressed to accomplish everything outlined here.

The proposer appears to have relevant development experience (particularly in the data back end) although no specific links or examples were given. No information is given on how onboarding participants would be achieved or how much participation would be required to make the project a success.  This makes it difficult to assess the feasibility of attracting new delegation participants.  The  help bot is an interesting idea but may require specialized developers to create a product with good utility.
Is NLP really required? Does this not introduce more complexity? Does the proposer have experience with NLP?

Based on the proposer's experience, the proposal seems to be feasible, especially because all of this developments could be done off-chain and has experience with software engineering. The NLP development might need special AI background, and this was not mentioned explicitly in the proposal, but I believe it would be covered by the proposer's background.

The proposer is operating WISE pool and has referenced his capability in the backend services required to complete the project. WIth these credentials, it can be safely said that the proposal will be implemented in right earnest.

The Notification Service description provided some good details; More details on the other services would be helpful to illustrate the scope of the work that needs to be done and what each service would look like when completed.

Auditability: 3/5

The proposer gives a good breakdown of the allocation of funding, but they have not set specific goals that address the key points of the challenge.  This will make assessment of the success of the program difficult. How many users and how much participation would be considered a success? How can you differentiate users who already delegate from first time delegators?
How new users find out about this? Will adding another thing not even more overwhelm new users?

The roadmap is clear and well explained, and milestones are also there linked to some dates, which is very good. The budget is broken down, but it's almost all for developer costs, which would be ok if developer part was not that high. It seems a bit too much for the proposed solution. Also, the proposal would benefit from some KPIs and estimations related to the usage of the tool, how much time this would save for new comers and also how many people would eventually be impacted by it.

The phases of the proposal is well laid out and clearly explained. It is a open-source project and is auditable. However, the proposed cost is for hosting it for six months. The sustenance and plan for continued service and exploitation of the developed software are not given clearly.

solution: Our platform **solves** these **problems** through **data-driven analysis** and **decision** making by providing **intelligent services** and **tools**.
experience: **9 years** of professional experience in **software engineering** and administration of database systems. Focus: **databases and performance analysis**
